head.title: Health Insurance Program Comes to the County

hedline.hl1: Health Insurance Program Comes to the County

abstract.p: Healthpass, insurance program for small businesses that allows workers to choose from 20 different health plans, will expand from New York City to Westchester County on October 1 (S)

block.p: Healthpass, an insurance program for small businesses that lets workers choose from 20 different health plans, will expand from New York City to Westchester on Oct. 1.

The program, which was initiated in November with a $1 million grant from the city government, lets companies with less than 50 workers set their contribution level while allowing employees to choose from plans offered by four insurance companies.
Healthpass, an insurance program for small businesses that lets workers choose from 20 different health plans, will expand from New York City to Westchester on Oct. 1.

The program, which was initiated in November with a $1 million grant from the city government, lets companies with less than 50 workers set their contribution level while allowing employees to choose from plans offered by four insurance companies.
The companies are Group Health Incorporated, HIP Health Plan of New York, Horizon Healthcare and PHS Health Plans. Premiums start at $189 for an individual policy.

The expansion is a result of requests by brokers that the program be made available in Westchester. So far 260 companies have enrolled in the plan, which is run by the New York Health Purchasing Alliance, a nonprofit agency created for the purpose.
